Race.SpecificTitle: Maple Area Res Sec Tx Dst -- Special Annual Fee - BOC - 5 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Maple Area Residents Security Tax District Proposition

Summary: The levy of a special annual fee for five (5) years in an amount not to
exceed four hundred dollars ($400) in 2010 and not to exceed four hundred dollars
($400) plus annual increases of twenty-five dollars ($25) for each year from 2011
through 2014 upon each improved parcel of land in the Maple Area Residents Security
Tax District to promote and encourage the security, beautification and overall
betterment of the Maple Area Residents Security Tax District.
Race.FullText:
Shall the city of New Orleans levy a special annual fee (except that no fee shall be
imposed upon any parcel whose owner qualified for the special assessment level
provided by Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Louisiana Constitution), to be called the
Maple Area Residents Security Tax District Fee, on each improved parcel of land in the
Maple Area Residents Security Tax District (which District is comprised of that area of
the city of New Orleans located within and including the following perimeter streets and
avenues: the middle of South Carrollton Avenue to Willow Street, the middle of Willow
Street to Audubon Street, the middle of Audubon Street to St. Charles Avenue, the
middle of St. Charles Avenue to the middle of South Carrollton Avenue) as specified by
Resolution R-08-690 (as corrected) of the City Council of New Orleans in an amount not
to exceed four hundred dollars ($400) in 2010 and not to exceed four hundred dollars
($400) plus annual increases of twenty-five dollars ($25) for each year from 2011
through 2014, which fee is estimated to generate approximately five hundred ten
thousand dollars ($510,000) annually, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and
encourage the security, beautification and overall betterment of the Maple Area
Residents Security Tax District as determined and managed by the Board of
Commissioners of the Maple Area Residents Security Tax District, which additional
security (public or private) or any other services or betterments provided by the District
shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the
District by the State of Louisiana or the city of New Orleans or their departments or
agencies or by other political subdivisions?
